paragraphs.text: Iran Sanctions Fight: Three myths no lawmaker should believe.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: The expected congressional vote on a new sanctions bill against the Iranian regime has rekindled debate over Tehran's nuclear defiance and the best way to confront it
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Congress has misgivings about a rogue regime intent on obtaining nuclear capability, and understandably wants to ensure that Washington does not strike a bad deal
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Some argue that a decisive approach toward Tehran will be counterproductive
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But their position ignores historical lessons and stands on a number of myths that need to be debunked
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Myth #1
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: More sanctions on Iran will prompt the regime to unilaterally walk away from the talks
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Iran cannot afford to walk away
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: because it is desperate and vulnerable
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It has a genuine interest to secure the lifting of existing sanctions
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: which provided the initial impetus for the regime to talk
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Then
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: too, cynics argued that sanctions would prompt Tehran to accelerate its nuclear activities
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The regime is playing a game of attrition, aiming to weaken U.S  resolve, win more concessions, and maintain its nuclear infrastructure
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The bipartisan sanctions bill will force Tehran to consider speedy compliance
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This month, Iranian President Hassan Rouhani reiterated,"Breaking the anti- Iran sanctions is the only way to achieve national progress," acknowledging that Iran's devastated economy cannot endure the weight of further sanctions, especially after the recent decline in oil prices
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: The mullahs are paranoid of a disenchanted population already on edge
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: With rampant unemployment, inflation, and loss of oil revenues, walking away from the talks is not an option
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: especially if a sanctions-in-waiting bill is hovering over their head
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Myth #2
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: With more sanctions, Tehran will blame Washington for sabotaging diplomacy, and start on the path towards war
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Even with slumping oil revenues - slashed by at least 45%- the official defense budget has jumped 30%, mostly allocated to the Islamic Revolutionary Guards Corp (IRGC)
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: And
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: more money is being funneled into Syria and Iraq to execute Tehran's designs - a budget that is twice that of all the country's publically funded universities combined
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: sanctions fail to force Tehran to abandon key parts of its nuclear program after over a year of negotiations
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: , then
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: continued talks with no additional leverage will fail as well
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The IAEA still has no access to suspect nuclear sites
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: its questions remain unanswered
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: IAEA Director General Yukiya Amano said in November 2014, "Iran has not provided any explanations that enable the Agency to clarify the outstanding practical measures, nor has it proposed any new practical measures in the next step of the Framework for Cooperation, despite several requests from the Agency."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Senior U.S  officials have repeatedly stated that even without additional sanctions the chances for reaching an agreement with Iran is less that 50 percent
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: So
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: as
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Iran tries to wear out western negotiators
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: clearly, additional leverage from Congress is necessary, not counterproductive
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Myth #3
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: New sanctions will strengthen "hardliners" in Iran who want to sabotage a prospective deal
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This is perhaps the most enduring myth in Washington that has dangerously infected Iran policy
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The idea that there are moderate elements in Iran's body politic, and the U.S  needs to reach out to them by making more concessions is ludicrous
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The oft-cited dichotomy between "hardliners" and "moderates" in Iran badly misrepresents a system whose elements are united in their strategic objectives
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Rouhani, himself a longtime confidant of Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei, was instructed by the latter to sign onto the Joint Plan of Action in November 2013
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Foreign Minister Zarif told the Iranian Parliament earlier this month that he has the full trust of Khamenei to continue the negotiations
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Experience has shown that diplomacy without leverage has never worked with dictators, especially in Tehran
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This puts Congress on the right path
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The sanctions bill can be a game- changer
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It will strengthen Washington's hand while helping to peacefully arrest Tehran's advance towards the bomb
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: One thing is for certain
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Tehran's nuclear objective is anything but a myth
paragraphs.label: assumption
